typeSystemDescription.name: Examples
typeSystemDescription.vendor: Ubiquitous Knowledge Processing (UKP) Lab, Technische Universität Darmstadt

typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.PolarExpression
typeDescription.description: A polar expression. E.g. "mögen, hassen, gut, schlecht, ..."

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The numeric value of the polar expression. Positive: 1.0 Neutral: 0 Negative: -1.0

featureDescription.name: category
featureDescription.description:
Category is the second token of a line in the lexicon input. Possible categories: NEG, POS, INT, SHI
Example: "fehlschlagen NEG=0.7 verben " category= NEG

typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.SentimentExpression
typeDescription.description: A sentiment expression made up of a polar expression and possibly a shifter.

typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.Shifter
typeDescription.description: A shifter "shifts" sentiments. Examples: "kein, weniger, nicht, ..."
